intro: Silene saxifraga subsp. sennenii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada silene, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its flowers are typically arranged in racemes and bloom during the summer months. Silene saxifraga subsp. sennenii is adapted to cold climates and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its high-altitude environment.
